meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be transplanted.
meanings.sent1: The transplantability of the flower allowed it to thrive in a new garden.
meanings.sent2: The success of the surgery depended on the transplantability of the organ.
meanings.sent3: The transplantability of the tree made it the perfect candidate for relocation.
meanings.sent4: Her adaptability was like the transplantability of a resilient plant.
meanings.sent5: The transplantability of the idea into a different context sparked creativity.

meanings.definition: The ability to move or transfer something from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The transplantability of the data ensured smooth migration to a new system.
meanings.sent2: The transplantability of the fish allowed it to thrive in various habitats.
meanings.sent3: The transplantability of the rumor spread quickly through the office.
meanings.sent4: His leadership skills demonstrated the transplantability of knowledge across teams.
meanings.sent5: The transplantability of the concept to different industries highlighted its versatility.
